arts.ttl: ‘Very valuable’ – Former Hull City player reacts on Sky Sports to Coventry City draw
arts.sum: Hull City’s point against Coventry City was ‘very valuable’, according to their former player George Boateng. Hull City… The post ‘Very valuable’ – Former Hull City player reacts on Sky Sports to Coventry City draw appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard confirms another Coventry City player out of the final run-in as two more touch and go
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Meanwhile, defender Bobby Thomas and winger Ephron Mason-Clark both sat out Monday night’s 1-1 draw at Hull with issues that don’t appear to be too serious but put them in doubt for Good Friday’s CBS Arena clash with West Bromwich Albion.

arts.ttl: Hull City boss Ruben Selles explains John Egan's exit as Tigers hope for positive prognosis
arts.sum: "John started to apparently detect something; some problem in there with his vision during the second half, so that's why we needed to stop the game," Selles said after seeing his side recover from Charlie Hughes' unfortunate own goal at the start of the second half to snatch a draw when Abu Kamara equalised late on. "I knew that Abu and Nordin could make an impact in the positions that we brought them in, and then we moved Joe Gelhardt a little bit higher up the pitch.

arts.ttl: Hull deny playoff-chasing Coventry as Frank Lampard left frustrated in stand
arts.sum: Frank Lampard watched on from the stands as his playoff-chasing Coventry side were held to a 1-1 draw at struggling Hull. Lampard served a one-match touchline ban at the MKM Stadium and was fined £2,000 after his sending off at the end of the defeat by Burnley earlier this month for an outburst at referee James Bell. While Coventry largely dominated Hull and went ahead through a deflected strike from Matt Grimes, who earlier produced two goalline blocks to deny Kasey Palmer, substitute Abu Kamara equalised. Lampard’s side therefore stay sixth, moving three points clear of seventh-placed West Brom, and the manager may rue his team’s lack of a clinical edge as Hull goalkeeper Ivor Pandur made several important saves. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles delivers verdict on Hull City's Coventry City fightback
arts.sum: "I expected that ball to go into the net, to be honest, and I think Kasey also wanted to score that goal," he continued. Selles admits that Palmer's gilt-edged miss sums up the Tigers' problems in front of goal this season, with Kamara's strike just their 41st in 42 games.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard gives verdict as Coventry City drop points at relegation battlers Hull
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. The Sky Blues created several good chances which were denied by a combination of good saves and a lack of clinical finishing but finally got their rewards when Matt Grimes scored from a wicked deflection two minutes into the second half.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings in tale of two deflections at Hull - Andy Turner
arts.sum: There was some desperate defending at the other end, however, when former Coventry star Kasey Palmer was denied what looked an almost certain opener for the hosts, only for some heroic blocking on the line from Matt Grimes as the playmaker had two bites of the cherry but the Sky Blues somehow managed to keep the ball out. City grabbed the lead in the second minute of the second half when Grimes hit a hard and low effort from just outside the box, with his shot taking a wicked deflection off Hull’s Charlie Hughes to wrong-foot the keeper and roll over the line.

arts.ttl: Abu Kamara rescues precious point for Hull City in Coventry City draw
arts.sum: The first half was goalless, and while Ivor Pandur made four good saves to deny Haji Wright and Ellis Simms, the gilt-edged chance fell near the end of the first 45 minutes when Kasey Palmer somehow managed not to score from close range after Regan Slater's cutback. Just as it did against Luton Town, disaster struck at the start of the second half when Matt Grimes' volley cannoned off Charlie Hughes and into the back of the net, wrongfooting Pandur, and that was that, before the Tigers salvaged it late on.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Ivor Pandur shines to help Tigers claim huge point
arts.sum: Lightening does strike twice for City, who conceded at the start of the second half yet again when Matt Grimes' volley cannoned off Charlie Hughes and into the back of Ivor Pandur's net. The first half was a watchable encounter, in truth, and though the visitors created the better of the chances with Pandur keeping them at bay, City should have been in front when Kasey Palmer somehow missed two efforts from close range just before the interval.

arts.ttl: Tale of two deflections as Hull and Coventry draw
arts.sum: Two heavily-deflected goals saw Hull and Coventry play out a 1-1 Championship draw.
